node.name: routing-instance
node.description: A routing instance, in the context of the RIB information model, is a collection of RIBs, interfaces, and routing parameters.None

node.name: name
node.description: The name of the routing instance. This MUST be unique across all routing instances in a given network device.None

node.name: interface-list
node.description: This represents the list of interfaces associated with this routing instance. The interface list helps constrain the boundaries of packet forwarding. Packets coming on these interfaces are directly associated with the given routing instance. The interface list contains a list of identifiers with each identifier uniquely identifying an interface.None

node.description: A reference to the name of a network-layer interface.None

node.name: router-id
node.description: Router ID: The 32-bit number in the form of a dotted quad.None

node.name: lookup-limit
node.description: A limit on how many levels of a lookup can be performed.None

node.name: ip-rpf-check
node.description: Each RIB can be optionally associated with a ENABLE_IP_RPF_CHECK attribute that enables Reverse Path Forwarding (RPF) checks on all IP routes in that RIB. An RPF check is used to prevent spoofing and limit malicious traffic.None

node.name: route-update
node.description: To update a route or a list of routes of a RIB. The inputs: 1. The match conditions, which could be: a. route prefix, b. route attributes, or c. nexthop. 2. Actions: 1. update the nexthop 2. update the route attributes The outputs: success-count - the number of routes updated failed-count - the number of routes fail to update failure-detail - the detail failure info None
